steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1b8l","text":"Typical reaction volume is   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fa08b","text":"Add dye in 1:1 ratio to about   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6o7ak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c9up","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dpiv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"B4A42EF09B3A11EC812B6918CEF175AD","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"20","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C0069CB09B3A11EC812B6918CEF175AD","id":0,"label":"LRRK protein","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":32,"style":"sup"},{"length":4,"offset":46,"style":"sup"}],"key":"6v04k","text":"This protocol was used for LRRK1RCKW and LRRK2RCKW but should apply to other similar proteins and constructs as well.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vc60","text":"Remove excess dye by a buffer exchange through a Micro Bio-Spin P-6 desalting column (Bio-Rad). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bgf0","text":"Make sure to equilibrate the column with the LRRK2 Storage buffer beforehand. Follow directions included with the column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"etd5","text":"Repeat the exchange one more time to further remove the excess dye.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"96rs8","text":"Quantify protein concentration and label efficiency using a NanoDrop or equivalent method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
